page.title: 01KILWINNING--AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: Irvine was designated a new town in 1966 and joined two ancient royal burghs Irvine and Kilwinning with three villages Dreghorn, Springside and Drybridge.Situated 3 kilometres from the sea,at the north end of Irvine Bay Kilwinning straddles the River Garnock with the old town of Irvine to the south and Stevenson to the west. The ruins of Kilwinning Abbey,founded by Sir Richard de Morville,a Norman Lord around 1160, still dominate the town. The gable end of the south transept is the best feature.The first Freemasons were those who came to the building of the abbey and Kilwinning Masonic Lodge, the oldest in Scotland.Many visit it each year.Kilwinning today has many modern buildings as well as old ones.
